userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?

condition.description:
Sneezing, sore throat, a stuffy nose, coughing - everyone knows the symptoms of the common cold. It is probably the most common illness. In the course of a year, people in the United States suffer 1 billion colds.

You can get a cold by touching your eyes or nose after you touch surfaces with cold germs on them. You can also inhale the germs. Symptoms usually begin 2 or 3 days after infection and last 2 to 14 days. Washing your hands and staying away from people with colds will help you avoid colds.

There is no cure for the common cold. For relief, try

  • Getting plenty of rest
  • Drinking fluids
  • Gargling with warm salt water
  • Using cough drops or throat sprays
  • Taking over-the-counter pain or cold medicines

However, do not give aspirin to children. And do not give cough medicine to children under four.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases
condition.name: Common cold

carousel_items: Contains ibuprofen, so take it with food to avoid stomach problems and ulcers.
Diphenhydramine makes you tired, so take Advil PM before you go to sleep.
Don't take Advil PM with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
Don't take Advil PM if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Advil PM is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Ibuprofen is an NSAID that relieves pain and reduces fever. Diphenhydramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes and helps you sleep.
basics.bottom_line: Advil PM works well at relieving pain and also helps you sleep.
downsides: The pain reliever (ibuprofen) can interact with other medications and make health problems like stomach bleeding and ulcers worse.
The antihistamine (diphenhydramine) can make you feel groggy the next morning.
Can only take one dose in 24 hours.
Can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use it.

downsides_processed.orig: The pain reliever (ibuprofen) can interact with other medications and make health problems like stomach bleeding and ulcers worse.
The antihistamine (diphenhydramine) can make you feel groggy the next morning.
Can only take one dose in 24 hours.
Can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use it.

upsides: Advil PM works well when you have a cold or the flu, but can also be used for backaches, minor arthritis, and joint pain.
Can be used for anyone 12 years or older.
Isn't habit-forming like some other pain medicines and sleep aids.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Advil PM, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

description_processed.orig: Advil PM contains aspirin, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Advil PM, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM can harm unborn babies. Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Advil PM can harm unborn babies. Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains ibuprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It can lower the benefit of low-dose aspirin (81 mg/day) in people taking it to prevent heart attacks and stroke, especially if taking both drugs together for a long time. If you take aspirin every day, take Advil PM more than 8 hours before your aspirin dose and at least 30 minutes after your aspirin dose to lower this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Advil PM contains ibuprofen, an NSAID. NSAIDs can increase the risk of fluid buildup and swelling in the limbs. This can worsen heart failure, so the American Heart Association recommends that older people with heart failure and reduced heart function avoid taking NSAIDs.

risks_warnings.title: Increased falls
risks_warnings.description: Diphenhydramine, also known as Benadryl, is an antihistamine in Advil PM that can make you feel dizzy or drowsy. People who are at a higher risk of falls should avoid using Advil PM.
risk_factors: Taking other drugs that make you drowsy or dizzy

carousel_items: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough starts working in about 30 minutes.
Chlorpheniramine (the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough) can make you sleepy, so avoid activities that require you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days, or if you have a really bad sore throat with a fever, headache, nausea, or vomiting.
Don't take Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Aspirin relieves pain and reduces fever. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is good for multiple cold symptoms, but it's more medicine than you need if you only have one symptom.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The aspirin in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough interacts with many other drugs and health conditions.

upsides: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
Dextromethorphan (the cough suppressant ingredient) works well and has very few side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking with other medicines that make you less alert

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough can harm unborn babies. Aspirin can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough contains aspirin, which has been linked to a rare but serious illness called Reye syndrome. Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough shouldn’t be used in children and teenagers. If you notice changes in your child’s behavior or nausea and vomiting (early signs of Reye’s syndrome), call your doctor and get medical care right away.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

description_processed.orig: People taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold and Cough, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Cold and Flu. Make sure to tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a sign of a more serious infection.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Alka-Seltzer Plus Day Severe Cold and Flu, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Benadryl is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. It also makes you sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Benadryl is great for allergies, but curl up on the couch after taking it and get ready for a nap.
downsides: Benadryl makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Benadryl until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Benadryl to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Benadryl.
Don't use Benadryl if you are breastfeeding.

It can provide quick relief of allergy symptoms for both kids and adults.

It comes as a tablet, capsule, liquid, and quick dissolving tablet.

I take it 1 to 2 hours before bedtime. It helps me fall asleep, stay asleep, and get back to sleep if I do wake up. I am also more aware of my dreams when I take it.
Made me so wired that I had heart palpitations
It will make you sleep so do not take if you have something to do.
Puts me to sleep easily, but leaves me feeling groggy and foggy, and not very well rested. May be good for a red-eye flight, but at home I use melatonin instead.
In South Louisiana, fire ants are everywhere!!!!!  I take benadryl when I get some bites and it always helps the itching to stop.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: There are a variety of over-the-counter medications with the same ingredients as Benadryl. It's not safe to use more than one medication containing diphenhydramine (the ingredient in Benadryl) at the same time. Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 years and older have a higher risk of side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Benadryl. Watch for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. The drowsiness caused by Benadryl can make you "unsteady" on your feet, leading to a higher chance of falls.

risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Benadryl have trouble urinating. Don't take it if you already have problems with urination.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Benadryl have trouble urinating. Don't take it if you already have problems with urination.

risks_warnings.title: Vision changes
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl can affect your vision and worsen certain types of glaucoma. If you have glaucoma, talk with your doctor before using Benadryl.

risks_warnings.title: Breastfeeding
risks_warnings.description: Benadryl passes into the breast milk of nursing mothers and can cause harm to newborn babies. Don't use Benadryl if you're breastfeeding.

basics.benefits_moa: Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold is a combination medicine that treats cold symptoms. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose, watery eyes and sneezing.
basics.bottom_line: Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold is a good option to relieve cold symptoms for people with high blood pressure, but it doesn't help with nasal congestion.
downsides: Doesn't clear up nasal congestion.
If you don't need both of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

risks_warnings.title: Antihistamine side effects
risks_warnings.description: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold, can cause dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, and trouble urinating. Don't use this medication if you have a history of these problems.

description_processed.orig: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold, can cause dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, and trouble urinating. Don't use this medication if you have a history of these problems.

risks_warnings.title: Chronic cough from an infection
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you have lung problems like chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) or a chronic cough before taking Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold.  Make sure you tell your doctor if your cough doesn't go away after a week or comes back after getting better, especially if you're coughing up significantly more mucus (phlegm), which can be a signs of a more serious infection.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine in Coricidin HBP Cough and Cold, lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful and avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

basics.benefits_moa: Coricidin HBP Maximum Strength Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes.
basics.bottom_line: Coricidin HBP Maximum Strength Flu is a good option to relieve cold symptoms for people with high blood pressure, but it doesn't help with nasal congestion.
downsides: Doesn't clear up nasal congestion.

Chlorpheniramine, the antihistamine, can make you dizzy and drowsy. It could increase the risk of falls for elderly people.

basics.benefits_moa: DayQuil Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that treats cold and flu symptoms. Acetaminophen relieves pain and reduces fever. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: DayQuil Cold and Flu is a useful combination medicine that relieves cold and flu symptoms, but make sure you really need all of its ingredients.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

downsides_processed.orig: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
To avoid hurting your liver, you have to keep track of the total amount of acetaminophen (APAP) you're taking since it's a very common ingredient in pain and cold/flu combination medicines.

upsides: DayQuil Cold and Flu is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, a cough, fever, and pain.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.
The pain reliever (acetaminophen) is easier on your stomach and has fewer drug interactions than other pain medications like aspirin or ibuprofen.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure

Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: DayQuil Cold and Flu can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Cough warning
risks_warnings.description: Stop using Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

description_processed.orig: Stop using Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF and talk to a doctor if your cough lasts more than 7 days, has too much mucus, comes back, or if you begin to have a fever, rash, or continuous headache. These signs could mean you have a more serious infection or problem.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: Robitussin Multi-Symptom Cold CF can harm unborn babies. Phenylephrine can be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

carousel_items: Doxylamine, the antihistamine ingredient, makes you tired so take it before you go to sleep.
Dextromethorphan, the cough suppressant ingredient, starts working in 15 to 30 minutes.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
Follow age-specific dosing instructions on how much to take. Don't take more than the recommended dose.
If you get the liquid form, use the dosing cup to measure the exact amount of medicine you need.
If your cough lasts more than 7 days, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM is a combination medicine that treats cold symptoms. Doxylamine is an antihistamine that relieves a runny nose and makes you very sleepy. Dextromethorphan is a cough suppressant.
basics.bottom_line: Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM can help you get a good night's sleep and stop coughing, but you can have a hard time waking up if you don't give yourself enough time to sleep.
downsides: Shouldn't be used unless you have a full night to sleep.
You shouldn't drive after taking it until you know how it affects you.
Drinking alcohol while taking this medicine isn't recommended.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Robitussin Nighttime Cough DM.

Can't use dextromethorphan if you're taking MAO inhibitors (drugs used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions). If taken together, they will cause dangerously high blood pressure levels.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Theraflu Daytime Severe Cold and Cough, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition when there's too much serotonin in the brain. The dextromethorphan in Tylenol Cold Multi-Symptom Daytime, when used with other medicines that affect serotonin (antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort), increases your risk for serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have these symptoms.

basics.bottom_line: Tylenol Cold Multi-Symptom Nighttime is a useful combination medicine that relieves cold and flu symptoms and will help you sleep. Make sure you really need all of its ingredients.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.

You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
